org.apache.juneau.remoteable

Annotation Type Path


  • @Documented
 @Target(value={PARAMETER,FIELD,METHOD})
 @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @Inherited
public @interface Path
    Annotation applied to Java method arguments of interface proxies to denote that they are path variables on the request.

    Example:

    @Remoteable(path="/myproxy") public interface MyProxy { @RemoteMethod(path="/mymethod1/{foo}") String myProxyMethod1(@Path("foo") String foo); }

    The argument can be any of the following types:

    • NameValuePairs - Individual name-value pairs.
    • Any serializable POJO - Converted to text using UrlEncodingSerializer.serialize(PartType,Object).
    • Map<String,Object> - Individual name-value pairs. Values are converted to text using UrlEncodingSerializer.serialize(PartType,Object).
    • A bean - Individual name-value pairs. Values are converted to text using UrlEncodingSerializer.serialize(PartType,Object).

    The annotation can also be applied to a bean property field or getter when the argument is annotated with @RequestBean:

    Example:

    @Remoteable(path="/myproxy") public interface MyProxy { @RemoteMethod(path="/mymethod1/{foo}") String myProxyMethod(@RequestBean MyRequestBean bean); } public interface MyRequestBean { @Path String getFoo(); }

    When used in a request bean, the value() can be used to override the path variable name. It can also be overridden via the @BeanProperty.name() annotation. A name of "*" where the bean property value is a map or bean will cause the individual entries in the map or bean to be expanded to path variables.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      Class<? extends PartSerializer> serializer
      Specifies the PartSerializer class used for serializing values to strings.
      String value
      The path parameter name.

    • Element Detail

      • value

        public abstract String value
        The path parameter name.

        A value of "*" indicates the value should be serialized as name/value pairs and is applicable for the following data types:

        • NameValuePairs
        • Map<String,Object>
        • A bean
        Default:
        "*"

      • serializer

        public abstract Class<? extends PartSerializer> serializer
        Specifies the PartSerializer class used for serializing values to strings.

        The default serializer converters values to UON notation.

        This annotation is provided to allow values to be custom serialized.

        Default:
        org.apache.juneau.urlencoding.UrlEncodingSerializer.class
